# Claude Code Development Guide

## Quick Reference

### Essential Commands

```bash
npm run dev        # Start development server (port 3000)
npm run build      # Production build (catches errors)
npm run lint       # Check for issues
npm run format     # Auto-fix formatting
```

### Content Locations

| Content Type | Location              | Library             |
| ------------ | --------------------- | ------------------- |
| Articles     | `content/articles/`   | `lib/articles.ts`   |
| Projects     | `content/projects/`   | `lib/projects.ts`   |
| Resume       | `content/resume/`     | `lib/resume.ts`     |
| Stack        | `content/stack/`      | `lib/stack.ts`      |
| Timeline     | See `lib/timeline.ts` | `lib/timeline.ts`   |

### Critical Paths

- Entry layout: `app/layout.tsx`
- Main layout: `app/(main)/layout.tsx`
- Routes: `app/(main)/[section]/page.tsx`
- Components: `components/[section]/`
- UI primitives: `components/ui/`

---

## Architecture Overview

### Tech Stack

- **Framework**: Next.js 15 (App Router)
- **Styling**: Tailwind CSS 4 + shadcn/ui
- **Content**: MDX with next-mdx-remote
- **Icons**: Lucide React
- **Animations**: Framer Motion

### Project Structure

```
portfolio/
├── app/                    # Next.js App Router
│   ├── (main)/            # Main layout group
│   │   ├── about/
│   │   ├── articles/
│   │   ├── projects/
│   │   ├── resume/
│   │   ├── stack/
│   │   └── timeline/
│   └── api/               # API routes
├── components/            # React components
├── content/              # MDX content files
├── lib/                  # Utility functions
├── types/                # TypeScript types
└── public/               # Static assets
```

---

## Code Patterns

### Creating a New Page

```tsx
// app/(main)/[section]/page.tsx
import { Metadata } from 'next'
import { PageHeader } from '@/components/page-header'

export const metadata: Metadata = {
  title: 'Section Title',
  description: 'Description for SEO',
}

export default async function SectionPage() {
  const data = await getData()

  return (
    <>
      <PageHeader title="Title" description="Description" />
      {/* Content */}
    </>
  )
}
```

### Content Library Pattern

```ts
// lib/[content].ts
import fs from 'fs/promises'
import path from 'path'
import matter from 'gray-matter'

const CONTENT_DIR = path.join(process.cwd(), 'content/[type]')

export async function getAll(): Promise<ContentType[]> {
  // 1. Read directory
  // 2. Parse frontmatter with gray-matter
  // 3. Return sorted array
}

export async function getBySlug(slug: string): Promise<ContentType> {
  // 1. Read specific file
  // 2. Parse frontmatter
  // 3. Return with content
}
```

### Component Conventions

```tsx
// components/[section]/[component].tsx
'use client' // Only if client-side interactivity needed

import { ComponentProps } from '@/types/content'

interface Props {
  data: ComponentProps
  className?: string
}

export function ComponentName({ data, className }: Props) {
  return (
    <div className={cn('base-styles', className)}>
      {/* Implementation */}
    </div>
  )
}
```

---

## Development Guidelines

### Mandatory Before Commits

1. **Format & Lint**: `npm run format && npm run lint`
2. **Type Check**: `npm run build` (catches type errors)
3. **Visual Check**: Verify in browser

### Style Patterns

```tsx
// Use Tailwind utilities
<div className="rounded-lg border bg-card p-4 shadow-sm" />

// Dark mode
<span className="text-muted-foreground dark:text-muted-foreground" />

// Responsive
<div className="grid grid-cols-1 md:grid-cols-2 lg:grid-cols-3" />
```

### Adding New Content Type

1. Create type in `types/content.ts`
2. Add library in `lib/[type].ts`
3. Create content files in `content/[type]/`
4. Add page in `app/(main)/[type]/page.tsx`
5. Create components in `components/[type]/`

---

## Common Tasks

### Add Article/Project

1. Create MDX file in appropriate `content/` folder
2. Add cover image to `public/images/[type]/[slug]/`
3. Follow existing frontmatter pattern

### Modify Navigation

Edit `components/nav.tsx` - add item to `navItems` array

### Update Theme

- Colors: Check Tailwind config and `app/globals.css`
- Components: Modify `components/ui/` primitives

---

## Troubleshooting

| Issue               | Solution                                   |
| ------------------- | ------------------------------------------ |
| Styles not updating | Restart dev server                         |
| MDX errors          | Check frontmatter syntax, ensure valid JSX |
| Build failures      | Run `npm run lint`, check console errors   |
| Type errors         | Verify imports, check `types/content.ts`   |

---

## File Quick Reference

| Task                | Primary File(s)                |
| ------------------- | ------------------------------ |
| Site metadata       | `app/layout.tsx`               |
| Global styles       | `app/globals.css`              |
| Navigation          | `components/nav.tsx`           |
| Footer              | `components/footer.tsx`        |
| MDX components      | `components/mdx/index.tsx`     |
| Content parsing     | `lib/mdx.ts`                   |
| Utility functions   | `lib/utils.ts`                 |
| Type definitions    | `types/content.ts`             |
| Tailwind config     | `tailwind.config.ts`           |

---

## Documentation

For detailed documentation, see:

- `docs/README.md` - Documentation index
- `docs/BACKLOG.md` - Feature backlog and priorities
- `docs/DECISIONS.md` - Architecture decision records
- `docs/features/` - Feature-specific documentation
- `docs/changelog/` - Release history
- `docs/sprints/` - Sprint briefings

---

_Keep this guide updated as the codebase evolves._

I have completed my warmup exploration. Here is a summary of what I found:

## Codebase Overview

This is a **Next.js 15 portfolio website** with the following characteristics:

### Technology Stack
- **Framework**: Next.js 15 with App Router and Turbopack
- **Language**: TypeScript
- **Styling**: Tailwind CSS 4 + shadcn/ui components
- **Content**: MDX files parsed with next-mdx-remote and gray-matter
- **Search**: Fuse.js for client-side fuzzy search with pre-built index
- **Animations**: Framer Motion
- **Icons**: Lucide React

### Architecture
- **Route Groups**: Uses `(main)` route group for consistent layout
- **Content-Driven**: MDX files in `/content/` for articles, projects, resume, stack
- **Library Pattern**: Each content type has a corresponding library in `/lib/` for data fetching
- **Component Organization**: Components grouped by feature (articles, projects, search, etc.)

### Key Sections
1. **Home** - Landing page
2. **About** - About page with MDX content
3. **Articles** - Blog posts with dynamic routes and OG images
4. **Projects** - Portfolio projects with detail pages
5. **Resume** - Resume/CV page
6. **Stack** - Technology stack showcase
7. **Timeline** - Career/life timeline

### Search System
- Pre-built search index via `scripts/build-search-index.ts`
- API route at `/api/search`
- Dialog-based UI with keyboard shortcuts

### Critical Files for Implementation

- `/Users/dfotesco/Portfolio/portfolio/CLAUDE.md` - Development guide with patterns and conventions
- `/Users/dfotesco/Portfolio/portfolio/types/content.ts` - Core TypeScript interfaces for all content types
- `/Users/dfotesco/Portfolio/portfolio/app/(main)/layout.tsx` - Main layout wrapper for all pages
- `/Users/dfotesco/Portfolio/portfolio/lib/articles.ts` - Example content library pattern to follow
- `/Users/dfotesco/Portfolio/portfolio/components/search/search-dialog.tsx` - Search feature implementation
